summary: This code imports the qrcode library, defines a function makeAndSaveQrcode that generates and saves QR codes using the make() function from qrcode library, and includes an example usage in the if __name__ == "__main__": block.

details.comment: This code imports the qrcode library, defines a function makeAndSaveQrcode that generates and saves QR codes using the make() function from qrcode library, and includes an example usage in the if __name__ == "__main__": block.
details.content:
# Importing library
import qrcode
# Encoding data using make() function
def makeAndSaveQrcode(data, save_path, debug=False):
    img = qrcode.make(data)
    if debug:
        print("image type:", type(img))
    img.save(save_path)
# <class 'qrcode.image.pil.PilImage'>
# Saving as an image file
if __name__ == "__main__":
    data="https://b23.tv/DPn1G4p"
    save_path = 'MyQRCode1.png'
    makeAndSaveQrcode(data, save_path)
